009package imagingbook.common.filter.examples;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilterSeparable;
015import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
016import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * <p>Example filter based on {@link GenericFilterVector} performing
021 * linear convolution with a custom 3x3 filter kernel.
022 * Typically used on RGB color images (with 3-element pixel vectors).
023 * Pixels in scalar-valued images are treated as 1-element vectors.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * Usage:
027 * </p>
028 * <pre>
029 * ImageProcessor ip = ...      // any image but typically a RGB color image
030 * GenericFilter filter = new ExampleFilter3x3Vector();
031 * filter.applyTo(ip);          // modifies ip
032 * </pre>
033 * <p>
034 * Note: This is merely a linear filter with a custom kernel to demonstrate
035 * the concept of a generic filter.
036 * In practice (depending on the type of kernel) this would be implemented
037 * as a sub-class of {@link LinearFilter} or {@link LinearFilterSeparable},
038 * which is much more efficient.
039 * </p>
040 * 
041 * @author WB
042 * @see LinearFilter
043 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
044 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)
045 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor, OutOfBoundsStrategy)
046 */
047public class ExampleFilter3x3Vector extends GenericFilterVector {
048
049        // custom (nonsymmetric) convolution kernel
050        private final static float[][] H = {
051                        {1, 8, 7},
052                        {2, 9, 6},
053                        {3, 4, 5}};
054        
055        private final static int width = H[0].length;                   // = 3
056        private final static int height = H.length;                             // = 3
057        private final static int xc = width / 2;                                // = 1
058        private final static int yc = height / 2;                               // = 1
059        private final static float s = (float) Matrix.sum(H);
060        
061        @Override
062        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) { // returns float[] pixel value
063                int depth = pack.getDepth();
064                float[] sum = new float[depth];
065                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
066                        int vj = v + j - yc;
067                        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
068                                int ui = u + i - xc;
069                                float[] p = pack.getPix(ui, vj);        // read float[] pixel value
070                                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
071                                        sum[k] = sum[k] + (p[k] * H[i][j]) / s;
072                                }
073                        }
074                }
075                return sum;
076        }
077
078}
